FuncDef:
The step command configures the step for rules in an MPAC policy.
The undo step command restores the default setting.
By default, the step is set to 5.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the step for rules in the MPAC policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A rule step is the difference between two automatically allocated rule numbers. If the step is set to 5, the system automatically allocates rule numbers 5, 10, 15, 20, and so on.
Using a rule step, you can maintain the rules and add new rules conveniently.
Prerequisites
An MPAC policy has been created using the service-security policy command.
Configuration Impact
After the step is configured for rules in an MPAC policy, the numbers of all rules are re-organized based on the new step.
Precautions
The step command configuration triggers the change of rule numbers but not the rule priorities.
